Yes, the costumes and makeup used in Kathakali are indeed very elaborate and vivid. The makeup in Kathakali is called "Chutti," and it is made by using a special powder mixed with rice paste to create a white base. The makeup is then further elaborated with intricate designs, and the color used depends on the character being portrayed - Green for heroes, red for particularly powerful people, and black for demons or negative characters.

The costumes used in Kathakali are designed to be eye-catching and intricate. The costume includes a heavily pleated skirt, a long-sleeved blouse, a brightly colored scarf worn around the waist and, in some cases, fur gauntlets extend from the elbow to the fingers. The headgear worn is particularly striking, with a large hat-like structure, which is covered in golden leaves or flowers.

The costume and makeup play an important role in the storytelling aspect of Kathakali. The vibrant colors, elaborate designs, and headgear signify the different emotions and personality traits of the characters portrayed in the performance. Overall, the costumes and makeup used in Kathakali are a stunning visual spectacle and a crucial element in bringing the characters to life.
